task_summary: Pick up the red block from the table using a robotic manipulator.

task_long_description.overview: A robot arm is instructed to locate and pick up a red block from a table. The environment is marked with blue tape for reference. The key role of the robot is to execute perception, approach, grasp planning, and manipulation to securely pick the red block. The robot uses visual feedback to find the target if it is not immediately visible, opens its gripper, approaches above the block, computes a grasp pose, and actuates the gripper to pick the block. Environment is static except for the red block.
preconditions: Robot is powered on and ready for operation
Red block is on accessible table area
stepwise_plan: Visually confirm the red block is present
Scan to locate the block if not initially visible
Detect the precise location of the block
Open the gripper to a suitable width
Move above the block at a safe height
Compute a grasp pose for a top approach
Perform the grasp action from computed pose
Verify the block is secured in the gripper
success_criteria: Block is firmly held in the gripper
Block is no longer resting on the table
failure_and_recovery: If the block is not visible, retry up to 3 scans
If grasp fails, restart from approach phase
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is in the gripper and lifted from the table surface

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red block is visible
Performs a scanning pattern to locate the red block
Detects the location of the red block
Opens the gripper to allow grasping
Moves the gripper above the target block
Computes the grasp pose (top approach) for the block
Performs grasping at the computed pose
Checks if the red block is now in the gripper

recovery_strategy: Retry scan and detection up to 3 times
Restart from approach if grasp fails
assumptions: Red object in instruction corresponds unambiguously to the red block in frames
The red block is always on a black table with blue tape for reference
No other red object is present; mapping is 1:1
Instruction requests both detection and pickup; no explicit place step in this phase

expected_success_criteria: The red block is firmly secured in the gripper
The block is off the table and no longer located within its original area
